description: Monitoring dashboard for Moderne agent instances

options.content:
## Moderne Agent Monitoring

This dashboard provides real-time monitoring of your Moderne agent instance(s). Use the **Agent ID** dropdown above to filter by specific agent.

**Key indicators:**
- **Status panels** below show current health at a glance (green = healthy, yellow = warning, red = critical)
- **Gateway connectivity** is critical - any disconnections will impact agent functionality
- **Disk space** warnings indicate cleanup is needed
- **Memory** near maximum may cause performance issues

**Troubleshooting:** If you see warnings, expand the relevant section below for detailed metrics.

panels.description: Time since agent started. If uptime is low, agent recently restarted.
panels.title: Agent uptime

panels.description: Total disconnections in selected time range. Should be 0 for healthy operation.
panels.title: Gateway disconnections

panels.description: Current CPU usage. Over 80% sustained may indicate resource constraints.
panels.title: CPU usage

panels.description: Available system memory. Less than 1GB available may cause performance issues.
panels.title: Memory available

panels.description: JVM heap memory usage. Over 85% may trigger frequent garbage collection.
panels.title: JVM heap usage

panels.description: LST downloads in the last hour. Indicates recent agent activity level.
panels.title: LST downloads (1h)

panels.description: Total gateway disconnections since agent start. Should remain at 0 - any increase indicates connectivity issues between agent and Moderne platform.
panels.title: Gateway disconnections (cumulative)

panels.description: Total connection retry attempts. Increases during network issues or platform maintenance. Should be flat during normal operation.
panels.title: Gateway connection retries (cumulative)

panels.description: Current CPU usage percentage. Sustained high CPU (>80%) may indicate indexing/processing load or undersized host.
panels.title: System CPU usage

panels.description: System load averages over 1, 5, and 15 minutes. Higher load indicates more processes waiting for CPU. Compare to CPU core count.
panels.title: System load average

panels.description: Available system memory. Low memory (<1GB) may cause swapping and performance degradation.
panels.title: System memory available

panels.description: Network throughput. High during LST downloads or Maven index updates.
panels.title: Network I/O throughput

panels.description: Free disk space for agent storage. Low disk (<10GB) will prevent LST downloads and Maven index updates. Clean up old artifacts if space is low.
panels.title: Disk space available

panels.description: JVM heap memory usage vs maximum. Used approaching max triggers garbage collection. Consistently near max (>85%) indicates insufficient heap size.
panels.title: JVM heap memory usage

panels.description: Percentage of time spent in garbage collection. Over 10% indicates memory pressure and will impact performance.
panels.title: JVM GC overhead

panels.description: JVM thread counts. Live = currently active, Daemon = background threads, Peak = maximum since start.
panels.title: JVM threads

panels.description: Open file descriptors vs system maximum. Approaching max may cause "too many open files" errors.
panels.title: File descriptors

panels.description: File descriptor usage percentage. Over 80% may indicate file handle exhaustion.
panels.title: FD usage

panels.description: Count of LST operations per interval. Shows agent activity serving LST artifacts to Moderne platform. Downloads transfer actual LST files, lists enumerate available artifacts, describes fetch metadata.
panels.title: LST operations (count)

panels.description: Total LST downloads over the dashboard time range. Approximate value based on query intervals. Handles agent restarts automatically.
panels.title: LST downloads

panels.description: Average LST download duration per interval. High durations may indicate slow artifact repository or network issues.
panels.title: LST download duration (avg)

panels.description: LST download throughput in bytes per second. Shows data transfer rate when serving artifacts.
panels.title: LST download throughput

panels.description: Count of Maven index update operations per interval. Updates occur periodically to refresh artifact repository indexes.
panels.title: Maven index updates (count)

panels.description: Average duration of Maven index updates. First update (full) takes longer than incremental updates.
panels.title: Maven index update duration (avg)

options.content:
**These metrics are only available when specific features are configured:**

- **POM cache** - Only if InMemoryPomCache is configured in agent
- **Package management** - Only if pip/nuget package managers are configured
- **Repos.csv fetching** - Only if repository configuration is fetched from external source

If you see "No data", these features are not enabled on your agent.

panels.description: Maven POM cache operations (gets and puts). Only present if InMemoryPomCache is configured.
panels.title: POM cache operations

panels.description: Average duration of POM cache get operations. Only present if InMemoryPomCache is configured.
panels.title: POM cache duration (avg)

panels.description: Average package installation duration. Only present if pip or other package managers are configured.
panels.title: Package installation duration

panels.description: Count of repos.csv fetch operations. Shows how often repository configuration is refreshed.
panels.title: Repos.csv fetch operations (count)

panels.description: Average duration to fetch repos.csv configuration file.
panels.title: Repos.csv fetch duration (avg)

title: Moderne Agent
